attributes.action: end this current system of discrimination against Romanian workers.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We note that the UK does not require work permits for nationals of  
any EU member state prior to 1 January 2007, and request these same  
rights of access be granted to Romanian citizens.

It is clear from its eight months of operation that the worker  
restrictions have proved complex, costly and counter-productive.  We  
note that the system of restrictions cannot be administered  
effectively by the Border and Immigration Agency; that it will cost  
the British taxpayer at least £3m in 2007; and that it drives  
Romanian workers on to the black market, so forcing them into unsafe  
conditions and making them targets for exploitation.

In light of the very low numbers of Romanians coming to the UK since  
1 January 2007, we urge the government to end the discrimination of  
its work permit regime now, and allow Romanians the same chance to  
contribute fully to the UK economy as are afforded to other EU  
nationals.
